description: Plans for the site in Penistone include spaces for retail, hospitality and offices, developers say.
title: Transformation plan for Penistone former railway site
title_page: Transformation plan for Penistone former railway site - BBC News
maintext:
A derelict former railway site could be transformed into a new retail and hospitality space if plans are given the go-ahead.
Developers said they wanted to revitalise the partially-listed coal drops, railway signal house and sidings in Penistone, which once sat on the former Woodhead Line before it was scrapped due to the so-called Beeching cuts in the1960s.
According to Fairbank Investments, the firm behind the plans, the proposal for the site would also include space for offices and business units.
In its application to Barnsley Council, the company said its proposals would "revitalise this historic location, preserving its heritage while welcoming a new era of economic growth".
